desc: GoalsTo be able to create any number of android and iOS applications using one software component to scan and read passports MRZ codes using phone camera.SummaryWe created a project using opencv and tesseract using C++, Objective-C and Swift, got good results, but not good enough to read the MRZ text lines within a reasonable time frame and with the desired accuracy. We are able to find the text lines of the MRZ code, crop each line from a camera frame image and recognize characters with tesseract.We believe to improve the results what should be done is:- Pre-process the images to improve tesseract results (deskew, 1-bit, unsharp masking)- Train tesseract using the correct font (OCR-B);- Use multiple results to successfully read all the fields and verify each check digit;ObjectivesDevelop a software component that allows an app developer to create an app with passport reading capability without any knowledge of computer vision and OCR;Write a sample application using swift or objective-c and compatible with iOS 8+ and android that uses the specified component to start the passport scan and receives the result of the processing;Deliverables1) Sample application with source code;2) Framework/library used to scan passports, Identity cards, Visas built for and available to be used on iOS 8+ and android projects;Basic architecture that should be followedMethod to start the scanning;Input:- timeout: (int) // in seconds;Output:- lines // read strings of MRZ code;- success: boolean; // true if all the information was read and all the check digits verified;- firstRowSuccess; // true if the first row complies with expected structure- passportType;- country;- surName;- givenNames;- passportNumber;- passportNumberSuccess; // true if the passportNumber check digit is verified;- nationality;- birth;- birthSuccess; // true if the birth check digit was verified;- sex;- expirationDate;- expirationDateSuccess; // true if the expirationDate check digit is verified;- personalNumber;- personalNumberSuccess; // true if the personalNumber check digit is verified;- secondRowSuccess; // true if the last check digit is verified;- thirdRowSuccess; // true if the last check digit is verified;Details- When the scan method is called the user will see the live camera;- User will not be requested to do anything different from filming the passport (no button to take picture, for example);- As soon as a successful result is available or the timeout is reached the user will be redirected to the screen he was before and the method will return its results;- Even if the result is not successful the method shall return what was read. The boolean outputs (success, firstRowSuccess, passportNumberSuccess, birthSuccess, expirationDateSuccess, personalNumberSuccess, secondRowSuccess) will indicate success;Refs[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]
title: Android and iOS MRZ (TD1,TD2,TD3) passport reader (opencv and tesseract)

desc: Please read before bidding - I delete the automatic bids I receive in the first 2 minutes.1st step in a few projects that I have.  If efficient, I will provide you with the first exclusive bid for follow up projects.My personal development environment has Android Studio and Eclipse (Java EE IDE) with Tomcat Apache installed.  I am not overly experienced with it all, but have some basic knowledge that allows me to debug and fix minor issues.  I recently had a developer make many changes to the projects and have since changed PC's and not familiar enough with Android Studio/Tomcat/Eclipse to setup properly to be able to debug locallyProject details:On US (EST) hours, we can schedule a block of time and I will provide Teamviewer access.Deliverables1. I have an android application that I need to be able to debug.  I currently receive gradle and git errors when trying to perform updates on Android Studio.  I would like to resolve all development environment errors and Debug my android app by plugging device into USB port.2. I have a Servlet.  I need to be able to debug it locally on my PC using Eclipse, the windows Tomcat Service and a local MySQL.  (I used to be able to do this)  MySQL config may be needed to accomplish this.  The database file itself can be copied from the production server.Once this is finished, I have a number of projects that I need to start on quickly.   Ideally I need someone with strong knowledge in iPhone, Android,  Java, PHP, MySQL for mobile work, server work, website, and windows applications.  It is important to me that the developer is willing to work some US hours for proper communication.  Strong written English also critical.
title: Fix Development environment

desc: Hello.My name is Ian and I have had a game produced many years ago but I got frustrated with the graphics that I got. In short I put the game on ice despite knowing the game after I played it was fantastic and very addictive. But I could not launch it due to sub standard graphics. To give you some idea how long I have sat on it. Smart phones were not out at the time iQubes was produced. Much to do with it was smart phones were coming out with a different league of game play & graphics. So, I thought I would wait until I found some one who could migrate it to smart phones with fantastic graphics as you see today with titles such as candy crush.My game is a little like Candy but much better and more intelligent like Tetris but a leap forward. To give you some idea of the game play. Imagine Tetris merged with Candy crush with a sprinkle of chess. ( As in thought process)The game works on the old Sony erricson and it has been sort of migrated to the iPhone but very rough. So it's a copy of the game but upgraded graphics, very upgraded graphics!There are many functions such as local and global leaderboards. The ability to challenge others... But most importantly there will be a large cash prise for the person with the highest number of challenges won and top scores.
title: iQubes The $1,000,000 puzzle

desc: I need  an iPhone/iPad app.  I would like it designed and built.  I own and operate a floral business. I have a website already created and I'm needing to create an app for customers to subscribe for my created (FORGET-ME-NOTS)ei. a user will sign-up for monthly charge to not forget a specific date. The user will login with facebook, then fb will present a list of closes family and friends who have birthdays coming up. User will then get the chance to select each person and then select what type of flower arrangement each person should recieve from a provided list of pictures and discounted prices of arrangements. Also, the user would be able to checkout throught paypal. User will not be charged for any arrangement until 72hrs prior to each birthday. This is in order to give the florist time to craft and send or delivery the order. Local delivery under 5 miles FREE; Local delivery up to 30 miles $25. App will be published in google play and marketed to local audience within 30 mile radius of business 21 N. Front St., Suite 102-E Wilmington, NC 28401. Project Scope1. Develope Appa. Submit product list to developerb. App integration on facebook page2. Market Appa. Create targeted adds through facebook insight to specific age range, geographical location and interest.b. Create 9 more adds of similaritie3. Collect Feedback from Customers through facebook reviews.4.

Travelling the world and meeting a lot of people(travellers etc) has validated our intellectual property concept of Wandr and its purpose in the fast paced, fast changing millennial world. desc: Hello. We are looking for a hybrid mobile app for iOS and Android (along with web back-end), which will provide hourly consultation service and some service packages. The satisfaction of the service won't happen on the app. Only the payment will happen on the app. Registered users can access the following components:1. Consultation module: Users will be able to pay and schedule a consultation in pre-defined time-slots by the admin.2. Service package module: Users will be able to choose between 2-3 service package. Recurring payments should be enabled for the same. There should be provision to upgrade or down-grade between various packages and billing needs to be adjusted accordingly.3. Custom quotes module: This can be either for consultation or packages, which needs to be tailor-made as per the individual/ organisation. Should have provisions wherein the admin can put a special note and limitations of single-use, etc.4. Content module: Users should be able to access bite-sized information. The content once created by the admin should be pushed to all users.5. Live chat module: All registered users will see a small icon on the bottom right of the screen, enabling them to chat with the admin. This doesn’t need to be developed. Any SaaS platform (like [url removed, login to view]) can be integrated with the app.6. Discount and promo code module: The admin should be able to add a certain discount to all services, or selected services. There should also be a promo code feature, which can only be used for a selected number of times.7. Push notifications module: From a new article to an offer, the admin should be able to push info about the same via push notifications to the user’s device.8. Payment gateway: The app should allow processing via PayPal as well as a local payment gateway of Middle-East.9. Languages: The app should be having an option to switch languages, between Urdu and English.Only let me know the best/similar app projects done by you, in the bid. All other bids will be ignored. The performance of the app should be frictionless and I should be able to navigate between various screens within 1 second.
title: Building a hybrid mobile app

desc: We have developed already an iOS application and we are looking for a profile that is capable translating the iOS application into an Android one suitable for the Google Store. Therefore, we are looking for a junior Android developer,who is committed to hard work. Our future colleague should be comfortable working remotely and be fluent in written and spoken English. The right candidates show a strong focus for both functional and non-functional requirements such as responsiveness, resilience and fault-tolerance of Android applications.The right developer will provide us with the APK that we can upload to Google Play. All source code, assets, databases, and design will be transferred after the project is complete. We expect the project to be divided into phases where the first phase will be to flesh out the design and assets. The second phase is the programming, and the final phase is testing. The job offer is for one time project, which has an estimated duration of three months, since the development and testing cycles should be completed by 28/02/2018.Required elements to have:- Strong agile mindset and ideally experienced in working inside a team using Scrum and/or Kanban- Appreciation for writing asynchronous non-blocking code- Good knowledge of Continuous Integration tools and practices (Continuous Delivery would be a plus)- Strong focus on quality;- Experience on working with Jira and GitLab- Bachelor degree or higher in software engineering or similar.
title: Harmpool Android App
